README.md:
## Forward-Backward Newton method

This repository contains implementations of the forward-backward
Newton (FBN) method for solving separable convex optimization problems
of the form

```
minimize f(x) + g(x)
```

FBN is based on the concept of Forward-Backward Envelope (FBE), a continuously differentiable
function whose minimizers coincide with the solutions of the problem to solve.
For further information on the FBE and FBN please refer to [1,2].

The method is implemented for some examples of problems, and test scripts
are provided in order to compare it against other algorithms.

Problems implemented so far:
* Box constrained QP
* L1 regularized least squares
* L1 regularized logistic regression
* Matrix completion

### Future plans

Future plans include implementing the method with the Julia language.

### References

[1] P. Patrinos and A. Bemporad, "Proximal Newton methods for convex composite optimization," in IEEE Conference on Decision and Control, 2013, pp. 2358-2363. [doi:10.1109/CDC.2013.6760233](http://dx.doi.org/10.1109/CDC.2013.6760233)

[2] P. Patrinos, L. Stella, A. Bemporad, "Forward-backward truncated Newton methods for convex composite optimization," [arXiv:1402.6655](http://arxiv.org/abs/1402.6655) [math.OC], Feb. 2014.
